questionItem.question: How do you join strings together in PHP?
Which is NOT a valid assignement operator?
What is the difference between 'include' and 'require'?
questionItem.panswer: Include only includes the HTML in the file, while require includes the PHP code too.
Require only includes the HTML in the file, while include imports the HTML and PHP code.
Require will stop executing as soon as an error is reached, and include will continue executing the code after the error.
Include will stop executing as soon as an error is reached, and require will continue executing the code after the error.
questionItem.aanswer: Require will stop executing as soon as an error is reached, and include will continue executing the code after the error.

Which is NOT true about integers in PHP?
questionItem.panswer: An integer must have at least one digit (0-9)
An integer can contain comma or blanks
An integer must not have a decimal point
An integer can be either positive or negative
questionItem.aanswer: An integer can contain comma or blanks

questionItem.question: The strlen() function in PHP:
questionItem.panswer: returns the length of a string, in characters
searchs for a specified character or text within a string
returns the number of words in a string
randomizes order of letters in a string
questionItem.aanswer: returns the length of a string, in characters

questionItem.question: The strpos() function in PHP:
questionItem.panswer: returns the length of a string, in characters
returns the number of words in a string
randomizes order of letters in a string
searchs for a specified character or text within a string
questionItem.aanswer: searchs for a specified character or text within a string

questionItem.panswer: Computes the difference of arrays using keys for comparison
Pushes one or more elements onto the end of an array
Fetches the key of an array
Filters elements of an array using a callback function
questionItem.aanswer: Fetches the key of an array
